description:
from an email on the ML from garyk: 

When running nova boot without specifically assigning Quantum networks to the virtual nics, the code creates a virtual nic for each Quantum network. I think that this is a bug and it would be interesting to know what the intended functionality should be.

Dan's Response: 

This is something we were
planning on re-visiting after the initial nova/quantum v2 integration in F-2,
but we never did.  In Essex, which is that if no networks are
specified, the VM gets a NIC on each network it has access to (either
a private network owned by the tenant, or a 'public/shared' network).

Here's one possible approach: the cloud operator can specify an
ordered list of network-ids as part of Nova config.  A VM with no
networks specified via the API will get that ordered set of NICs.  If no such
networks are specified in the config, we could either give VMs no NICs
(probably not a great user experience) or default to giving a VM a NIC
on each shared network (would need a way to deterministically order
these shared networks for this to be reasonable).

Another option would be to keep the current behavior if no default  networks is specified in the nova config.
title: default NICs for Nova VMs with Quantum

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~danwent

comments.content:
Considering the output from the discussion on the mailing list, I am for implementing an approach where a 400 error is returned if no network is specified when an instance is launched. 

If nobody opposes this proposal, I will assign the bug to myself and push a patch for review
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~salvatore-orlando

comments.content:
I thought the output from the ML discussion was that we should leave it as is?

Once concern about the 400 approach is that even if I have a single flat network, the tenant needs to specify that network, which is kind of a pain, and a definite change from people used to nova, where they almost never specify --nic.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~danwent

comments.content: I can confirm the majority of opinion on the mailing list is for leaving things as they are, with the only alternative of an "order set of networks" specified in nova.conf
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~salvatore-orlando

comments.content: Certainly 'as they are' for Folsom, with revisiting afterward, by my reading.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ijw-ubuntu

comments.content: It seems the best thing we can do at this stage is to remove this bug from folsom-rc1.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~salvatore-orlando

comments.content: Dear nova bug gods, please unassign this from folsom.  Thanks.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~danwent

comments.content:
Why is this still considered High importance bug when the consensus seems to be that there should be no change in the default behavour ?  

Any change to provide a "default network" needs to take into account that with Quantum tenants will want to each have a different default, and should be a Blueprint.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~philip-day
